Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:patient c/o 5 weeks h/o mild menorrhagia (not checked), mild heavy menses, mild recent change in menstrual pattern. NKDA. patient is a 46 year old white f. o:Height 62 in, Weight 100 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 72, SystolicBP 114, DiastolicBP 77, Respiration 17, Skin = pallor a:Clotting p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed warfarin - 2 mg daily, and ordered CBC, PT, PTT.

content2.Unmatched: (not checked) , mild heavy menses , mild recent change

td.content: s:patient complained of mild recent change in menstrual pattern, mild heavy menses and mild menorrhagia. pt denied any fall or trauma. NKDA. she is a female fortune teller aged 46 yrs. o:Height 62 in, Weight 99 lbs, Temperature 98.2 F, Pulse 74, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 72, Respiration 15, Skin = pallor a:Clotting p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed aspirin - 325 mg daily, and ordered CBC, PT, PTT.
